results.title: Faust
results.creator_credit: Friedrich W. Murnau, Erich Pommer and UFA
results.brief_description: Classic silent German cinema from the talented F.W.Murnau, 1926. “The portals of darkness are open and the shadows of the dead hunt over the earth..” opens the film with the prevailing theme of good versus evil as the devil Mephisto does a deal with alchemist Faust for his soul and potentially for dominion over the Earth - promising he will stop the plague that is rife throughout Faust’s village. Faust reneges on the arrangement choosing love - much to the delight of Archangel St. Michael. Based on the original story by Goethe. Great cinematography and effects give the film a dark foreboding and general creepiness that add to the dramatic impact of the work. This edition features orchestral soundtrack by the Olympia Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: Fahrenheit 9/11
results.creator_credit: Michael Moore, Kathleen Glynn, Jim Czarnecki, Lions Gate Films, The Fellowship Adventure Group, IFC Productions (US) and Dog Eat Dog Films
results.brief_description: The heat is up in this award-winning documentary made by maverick dissident Michael Moore (“Bowling for Columbine”) with his sharp wit and biting commentary on the United States’ Government and contemporary America. President George W. Bush bares the brunt of this filmmaker’s wrath as Moore, with his sense of humour intact, sets about to make clear to the world American foreign policy and its consequences. This is the sort of filmmaking that gets people thinking, talking and hopefully, taking action. Not only did “Fahrenheit 9/11” win awards but its popularity with the cinema-going public created a record at the box office for a documentary film and paved the way for other works in the genre to be more prominent in the cinema exhibition market. Winner of Best Picture at Cannes 2004.

results.title: The Naked kiss
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Sam Firks, Leon Fromkess and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: Written, produced and directed by Samuel Fuller “The Naked Kiss” is a low-budget, tabloid melodrama. Its main character, a prostitute, wants to change her ways and ends up working in a hospital helping the handicapped. This moralistic and exploitative film is a unique look at outcasts showing the harsh realities that exist behind a seemingly civilized society. Outrageous in its time “The Naked Kiss” is a strange mixture of the moralistic and the perverse existing in suburbia. Cinematography by Stanley Cortez. Cast include Constance Towers, Anthony Eisley, Michael Dante and Virginia Grey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Samuel Fuller, Sam Firks, Leon Fromkess and Allied Artists Pictures

results.title: I Want to live!
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Walter Wanger, Figaro Films and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning performance by actress Susan Hayward in the lead role of Barbara Graham. Based on actual events and letters from Barbara at the time, comes the story of a girl who had spent time in reform school due to a hard youth when becoming a woman moves easily into the seedy underworld of drugs, parties and prostitution. Barbara attempts to go straight but falls back into her old ways when her junkie husband can no longer support her or her baby son. When two acquaintances are charged with murder they blame Barbara but she continues to protest her innocence. Vilified by the press and subject to an all male jury, Barbara Graham is tried and sentenced. The death penalty by gas chamber is her fate and very believably the way her character is transformed from good-time girl to suffering victim is testimony to the strength of Hayward’s performance. Shot in black and white with a driving jazz soundtrack (even an appearance by Gerry Mulligan) with tight direction by Robert Wise providing an overall intense dramatic experience.

results.title: Insomnia (2002)
results.creator_credit: Christopher Nolan, Andrew A Kosove, Broderick Johnson, Edward McDonnell, Paul Junger Witt, Witt Thomas Section Eight Productions and Alcon Entertainment
results.brief_description: A police detective (Al Pacino) wanted for questioning by Internal Affairs flies to Alaska to assist in a murder enquiry. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer (Robin Williams) to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. An earnest young police detective (Hilary Swank) is thorough in her investigative techniques and discovers the truth. Based on the film “Insomnia” directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg, this all-star version is just as compelling. Cast includes Martin Donovan, Paul Dooley.

results.title: Elephant (2004) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Dany Wolf, Home Box Office, Fearmakers Studios and Blue Relief
results.brief_description: This austere work from Gus Van Sant, based on the Columbine High School tragedy, presents two days in the life of the young killers and their victims. Following on from the style set in “Gerry” (2002) Van Sant allows long takes and unobtrusive camera work to watch the students in their milieu. Van Sant displays ordinary teenagers beset by loneliness, pettiness, insecurities and rivalry. Cast includes: Alex Frost, Eric Deulen, John Robinson, Elias McConnell and Jordan Taylor. Also available on VHS [319040].

results.title: Rain
results.creator_credit: Christine Jeffs, Philippa Campbell, Communicado, Rose Road and New Zealand Film Commission
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “Rain” by Kirsty Gunn from New Zealand filmmaker Christine Jeffs comes the story of an adolescent girl’s life-changing summer holiday. The girl’s parent’s marriage is not strong and her mother has an affair with another holiday-maker, fuelled along by alcohol. Confusion and jealousy occur in the young girl’s mind as she tries to come to terms with her own sexual awakening while trying to decipher adult relationships. Moody and atmospheric, the pace of the film is as leisurely as the holiday with gentle seaside in the day and partying parents at night. A mix of carefree playfulness (as the girl and her young brother frolic in this idyll) with a darker foreboding and uneasiness just under the surface. Original soundtrack by Neil Finn. Cast includes Alicia Fulford-Wierzbicki, Sarah Peirse, Marton Csokas, Alistair Browning, Aaron Murphy.

results.title: Anatomy of Hell = Anatomie de L'Enfer [DVD] (E)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Jean-Francois Lepetit, CB Films (France) and Flach Film
results.brief_description: A woman at a nightclub is rejected by her gay, male lover, becomes suicidal and goes to the toilets to cut her wrists. She is prevented from further harm by the kindness of another gay man (played by Italian porn star Rocco Stiffredi) who follows her. Their conversation leads the woman to set up a challenge or deal, that she will pay this man and he is to listen and learn about how men see women’s bodies. Over the next four nights the two engage in the most intimate acts and conversations in trying to work out the male/female sexual dynamic. From the controversial director of 1999’s “Romance” Catherine Breillat wants to shock with close-ups of genitals and discussions of menstruation that are sure to affect some viewers. Almost banned from release in Australia. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: The Safety of objects
results.creator_credit: Rose Troche, Christine Vachon, Dorothy Berwin, Clear Blue Sky Productions and Renaissance Films
results.brief_description: Four suburban families and four seemingly separate stories about the struggles of daily life. Life that’s messy around the edges - how we deal with our problems and each other when living the suburban life are explored in this film. Consumer society, shopping and personal objects - how important are they when compared with love and family? Written and directed by Rose Troche, based on a book of stories by A.M.Homes. Cast includes Glenn Close, Dermot Mulroney, Jessica Campbell, Patricia Clarkson, Joshua Jackson, Moira Kelly.

results.title: Out live = Bichunmoo
results.creator_credit: Kim Young-Jun, Yoo Jung-Ho, Lee Tae-Won and Taewan Entertainment
results.brief_description: The daughter of a concubine falls into a forbidden romance with a fearsome warrior of lowly descent. With her beloved feared dead, Sullie agrees to marry an evil Chinese warlord, under pressure from her corrupted father. Director Kim Young-Jun combines sweeping grandeur with exciting martial arts, and wire-work special effects (conjuring “Crouching tiger, hidden dragon”), to create a historical action picture. Based on the manga by Korean writer Kim Hye-rin. Cast includes: Shin Hyun-Joon and Kim Hee-Seon.
